ZA-NC | blank_name_sec1 = HDI (2017) | blank_info_sec1 = 0.682 · 5th | website = www.northern-cape.gov.za | footnotes = }} The Northern Cape (; ; ) is the largest and most populated province of South Africa. It was created on 27 April 1994 when the Cape Province was split up. Its capital is Kimberley. == References == Category:1994 establishments in South Africa
title: Northern Cape
